alert.note: Alert for Bay; Holmes; Walton; Washington (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 14 at 10:36PM EDT until June 15 at 12:00AM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tallahassee has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southern Geneva County in southeastern Alabama... Northwestern Bay County in the Panhandle of Florida... Walton County in the Panhandle of Florida... Holmes County in the Panhandle of Florida... Washington County in the Panhandle of Florida... * Until 1100 PM CDT. * At 935 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 14 miles east of Riverview to 6 miles northwest of Baker to Roeville, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. * Locations impacted include... Vernon, De Funiak Springs, Bonifay, Geneva, Chipley, Eglin Air Force Base, Bradford, Union, Liberty, Live Oak, Freeport, Paxton, Ponce De Leon, Caryville, Wausau, Esto, Westville, Ebro, Noma and Black. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM CDT for southeastern Alabama...and the Panhandle of Florida. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. This is a DANGEROUS SITUATION. These storms are producing widespread wind damage across the Florida Panhandle. SEEK SHELTER NOW inside a sturdy structure and stay away from windows! Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM CDT for southeastern Alabama...and the Panhandle of Florida.
